thread.title: Tories announce Goldsmith as mayoral candidate
thread.title_full: Tories announce Goldsmith as mayoral candidate

title: Tories announce Goldsmith as mayoral candidate
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Tories announce Goldsmith as mayoral candidate Zac Goldsmith is opposed to the prospect of a third runway at Heathrow Jonathan Brady/PA Zac Goldsmith is opposed to the prospect of a third runway at Heathrow Jonathan Brady/PA Callum Jones Political Reporter Published 32 minutes ago 
Zac Goldsmith has been confirmed today as Conservative candidate for London mayor in a development that places Heathrow expansion plans in fresh doubt. 
The MP for Richmond Park in southwest London, and prominent environmental campaigner, is vehemently opposed to the prospect of a third runway and has pledged to resign his seat should the government approve it. 
Mr Goldsmith had faced competition from Andrew Boff, a London Assembly member, Syed Kamall, the MEP, and Stephen Greenhalgh, one of the capital’s seven deputy mayors. While the potential candidates have been campaigning to win the primary, they were put forward by an Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
